title: In Kerala, a snakebite that sparked a change
description: Last month, Kerala declared snakebite envenomation a notifiable disease. Though snakebites are common in the State, a 2019 incident triggered a systemic overhaul. A 10-year-old girl had died of a venomous snakebite in a school in Wayanad, and people were outraged. Since then, a digital rescue network has been launched and school infrastructure upgraded. Sarath Babu George reports on Kerala’s quest for zero snakebite mortality

description: Sanju Samson is thrilled to join Chennai Super Kings for IPL 2026, eager to play alongside his idol MS Dhoni. Traded for Rs 18 Crore, Samson recalled his early admiration for Dhoni and the challenges of meeting him amidst crowds. He expressed immense excitement about sharing the dressing room, breakfast, and practice sessions with the legend.

title: Watch: Smriti Mandhana, Palash Muchhal’s cute Haldi moment melts the internet; fans swoon
description: India batter Smriti Mandhana and composer-filmmaker Palash Muchhal's wedding festivities have commenced with a vibrant Haldi ceremony. Held two days before their November 23 wedding, the event saw Mandhana, adorned in yellow, celebrating with family, friends, and teammates amidst traditional music and yellow decor. The intimate ceremony offered a colourful glimpse into the couple's wedding week.

description: The Supreme Court affirmed that the right to a speedy investigation is a fundamental right, stating that accused individuals cannot face endless suffering under the threat of ongoing probes. While not setting strict timelines, the court emphasized that inordinate delays can lead to the quashing of cases, benefiting the accused, victim, and society.

description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has handed the crucial Home portfolio to Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary of the BJP for the first time in two decades. In return, JDU secured Finance. This move significantly boosts Choudhary's standing within the alliance, with the Home department's control over police and law & order considered politically vital.

description: In a surprising White House meeting, Donald Trump and Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani found common ground on New York City's future, despite stark ideological differences. Trump expressed a desire for Mamdani's success, emphasizing the city's importance. Discussions touched on immigration and public safety, with both leaders prioritizing a strong NYC, showcasing a rare moment of bipartisan cooperation.

title: Nepal plans to deploy Army for polls as Oli forms party security unit
Dubai airshow crash: Demo ends in fatal hit; breaks Tejas’ near-flawless run since 2016
description: A Tejas fighter jet crashed during a Dubai Airshow demonstration, tragically killing IAF pilot Wing Commander Namansh Syal. The aircraft reportedly failed to recover from a negative G-turn. This marks the second Tejas crash since its induction, raising concerns for India's indigenous fighter project and its export ambitions. An inquiry is underway.

title: Trump says Ukraine's Zelenskyy will have to approve U.S.-backed peace plan
description: Mr. Trump said the approaching winter, the mounting death toll and repeated attacks on Ukrainian energy plants underscored the urgency of ending the war

title: CJI farewell: Gavai says anti-bulldozer ruling his most important; backs SC/ST sub-classification
description: Retiring CJI B.R. Gavai highlighted his judgment against "bulldozer justice" as his most significant, emphasizing its conflict with the rule of law and the right to shelter. He also cited the ruling allowing sub-classification of SCs and STs for reservations as crucial for addressing genuine inequality, quoting Ambedkar on the nuances of equality.

title: 'I’ll go when you go … Quiet, piggy': Kimmel hits back after Trump demands his firing
description: President Donald Trump reignited his feud with Jimmy Kimmel after the comedian’s blistering Wednesday monologue about the Epstein files and Trump’s Saudi state dinner. Within 11 minutes of the broadcast ending, Trump demanded ABC “get the bum off the air.” Kimmel hit back on Thursday’s show, mocking the president’s fixation and revisiting their September clash, as Trump simultaneously pressures networks to silence other late-night critics.

title: Afghanistan trade push: Kabul offers tax breaks, 1% duty; seeks deeper ties with India
description: Afghanistan is wooing Indian investors with a five-year tax holiday for new industries and a 1% import duty on raw materials and machinery. Commerce Minister Nooruddin Azizi highlighted priority sectors like cement and textiles, urging Indian companies to invest. He also sought India's help in keeping the Chabahar trade route open amidst logistical challenges.

title: Trump vows ‘we are going to be helping’ New York Mayor-elect Mamdani

title: Ukraine-Russia conflict: Putin welcomes US peace plan as 'final settlement'
description: In a diplomatic twist, President Putin of Russia expressed a measured acceptance of a US proposal aimed at peace in Ukraine, indicating it might pave the way for a resolution. However, he criticized Kyiv for what he termed as an unrealistic stance.

title: POSH Act for advocates: SC to hear plea on applicability; notice issued to HC ruling

The court issued a notice of appeal, emphasizing that professional bodies should have internal complaints committees to ensure a safe workplace for women in the legal profession.

description: New proposals for UK settlement status have drawn widespread criticism from the Indian diaspora. Foreign nationals arriving from 2021 onwards may face a 10-year wait for permanent residency, with care workers facing 15 years. This significantly alters the UK's attractiveness for skilled workers and students.

China building nuke-proof floating island: To prowl seas by 2028; what will it be used for?
description: China is reportedly constructing a massive, nuclear-blast-resistant floating artificial island, a 78,000-tonne semi-submersible platform designed for self-sustaining, long-term residency. Expected to be operational by 2028, this "mega science infrastructure" will accommodate 238 personnel and operate in contested waters, signaling a significant expansion of China's maritime power and "blue economy" agenda.

description: Actor-director Siddhanth Kapoor, brother of Shraddha Kapoor, has been summoned by Mumbai Police's Anti Narcotics Cell in a Rs 252 crore drug case. His name reportedly surfaced in connection with lavish parties attended by celebrities and individuals linked to the underworld. Kapoor is expected to record his statement on November 25.

description: Bitcoin and ether experienced significant drops to multi-month lows as investors retreated from riskier assets due to concerns over stretched tech valuations and diminished expectations of near-term US rate cuts. The broader crypto market has seen its value plummet by $1.2 trillion in six weeks, signaling a shift away from speculative investments.

From 'Widow-Maker' to market shaker: Why Japan’s bonds are sending shockwaves globally
description: Japan's bond market is experiencing a seismic shift as yields rise, ending decades of ultra-loose monetary policy. A massive stimulus package coincides with the Bank of Japan stepping back, rattling markets and potentially triggering capital repatriation. This marks a critical juncture for the world's most indebted nation.

Despite a late collapse from Bangladesh forcing the tie, India's Super Over batting imploded, scoring zero runs. This strategic blunder proved catastrophic, leading to their elimination.

Amazon layoffs: Nearly 40% cut targets engineers— company's steepest cut in 31 years
description: Amazon is cutting approximately 14,000 corporate jobs, with nearly 40% of those in New York, California, New Jersey, and Washington being engineering roles, disproportionately affecting mid-level software engineers. CEO Andy Jassy cited cultural shifts and a desire for leaner operations as the primary drivers, not financial or AI pressures, though AI efficiency is expected to shrink headcount in the future.

Exclusive | From ‘surviving on rice and water in Russia’ to 'burnout': Vidit's story
description: The FIDE World Cup 2025 in Goa is nearing its end. Indian Grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi has spoken out against criticism of the tournament's conditions. He highlights Goa's beauty and excellent hospitality. Gujrathi also discusses his friendship with Anish Giri and his own journey with burnout. He will next play in the Global Chess League 2025.

description: A global race is on to secure Arctic resources, particularly rare earths, as nations seek alternatives to China's dominance. Melting ice is unlocking Greenland's mineral wealth, attracting significant investment and sparking discoveries of crucial metals for electronics and defense. Sweden is also developing its own substantial rare earth deposits, though challenges in remote Arctic mining remain.

description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledged Google's AI advancements could temporarily impact the company, but expressed confidence in catching up. description: TNPSC Group 2 results 2025: The Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission (TNPSC) has declared the final results for the Assistant Public Prosecutor, Grade-II in Prosecution Department (Tamil Nadu General Service), Combined Civil Services Examination-IV (Group-IV Services), and Combined Technical Services Examination (Non-Interview Posts) today, November 21, 2025. Candidates can check their results online via the official TNPSC portal using their Registration Number and Date of Birth. Step-by-step instructions and direct links are provided for easy access to the results.

title: Broncos’ Jahdae Barron responds to backlash over Taylor Swift nod after Chiefs win
description: Denver Broncos cornerback Jahdae Barron delivered a career-defining performance, limiting Travis Kelce to minimal production in a 22-19 upset win. However, a lighthearted postgame social media joke referencing Taylor Swift quickly ignited backlash, overshadowing his impressive defensive effort and sparking a viral controversy.

Bangladesh A, needing just one run, secured victory on a wide ball after a missed stumping, ending a truly unforgettable contest.

The subsequent Super Over saw India collapse, losing both wickets for zero runs, capping a chaotic finish.

Watch: Last moments of Tejas jet; multiple videos capture Dubai air show disaster
Tejas fighter jet crashes in Dubai during air show; IAF confirms pilot dead
description: Tragedy struck the Dubai Air Show as an Indian Air Force Tejas fighter jet crashed during an aerobatic display, resulting in the pilot's fatal injuries. The HAL-built aircraft nosedived, causing a massive fireball and panic among spectators. Emergency teams responded swiftly to the incident. The IAF expressed deep regret over the loss of life.

title: 'Must rapidly rethink AI': Nadella's wake-up call; issues internal memo to employees
description: Google has launched Nano Banana Pro, an advanced AI image generator powered by Gemini 3. This upgrade offers superior reasoning, enhanced world knowledge, and precise text rendering. Users can now create higher-resolution images, control lighting and camera angles, and integrate real-time Google Search data, marking a significant leap for creative professionals.

title: Why the Internet keeps going down every few weeks
description: The internet experiences major outages every few weeks due to increasing centralisation—AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure now power most online services, creating single points of failure. Technical issues like DNS problems, configuration errors, and automation failures cascade across interconnected systems. Despite redundancy efforts, these outages disrupt emergency services, banking, and transportation.The decentralised internet envisioned for resilience has become a fragile network dependent on a few massive providers.

title: Rs 95 lakh per semester paid for Karisma's daughter, Priya's lawyer shows receipt in court
description: A Delhi High Court hearing saw Priya Kapur's legal team present strong evidence refuting claims of a forged will by Sunjay Kapur. Documentation, including fee receipts and digital trails, countered allegations, while the court examined the will's creation and authenticity. The case continues on November 21.

title: 'It’s been hard': Brittany Mahomes opens up on emotional toll of NFL spotlight
description: Brittany Mahomes, wife of NFL star Patrick Mahomes, has candidly shared her struggles with online hate. She revealed that while it's been a difficult journey, she's learned to protect her peace by stepping away from social media when negativity escalates. Despite facing criticism for her opinions and public presence, she remains a strong supporter of her husband and their family.

title: Savannah James gets emotional as daughter Zhuri joins new SZN Volleyball team
description: Savannah James celebrated her daughter Zhuri Nova's milestone as she begins her volleyball journey with the popular SZN team. Despite her family's basketball background, Zhuri Nova chose a different athletic path. The proud mother shared heartwarming clips and reflected on Zhuri Nova's 11th birthday, highlighting her daughter's intelligence and confidence.

title: Stephen Curry’s wife earns major nomination at 2025 Glossy Beauty Awards
description: Ayesha Curry's beauty brand, Sweet July Skin, has earned a nomination for Best Category Launch at the 2025 Glossy Beauty and Wellness Awards for its successful Lip Treatment. This recognition follows previous accolades for the brand, highlighting its growing impact in the beauty industry. The winners will be revealed on December 2, 2025.

title: LiAngelo ball goes platinum with breakout hit “Tweaker” featuring Drake
description: LiAngelo Ball, formerly a basketball player, has achieved a major milestone in music. His debut single 'Tweaker' has gone platinum. This success signifies a significant crossover from sports to the entertainment industry. The song became a cultural phenomenon, embraced by sports teams and charting highly. Ball's journey redefines his public identity and highlights his artistic ambition.
